title: 1 of 2020)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005), with
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 6) (Emergency Measures in 
the Public Interest-Jobseeker’s Benefit) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020. 

Commencement

title: 1 of 2020)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005), with
heading: 3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control)
text_raw:
3. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 
Regulations 2007 are amended by the insertion of the following article after 
article 52G: 

“Emergency measures in the public interest - jobseeker’s benefit. 

52H. 

(1) Subject to sub-article (2), section 62(4) shall not apply from 19 

March 2020 until the date specified in sub-article (2). 

(2) This article shall cease to have effect on 19 June 2020.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 12th May, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the forgoing 
Regulations. 

[164] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

7 May, 2020. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

8 May, 2020. 

REGINA DOHERTY, 

Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [164]

title: 1 of 2020)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005), with
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations temporarily extend, until 19 June 2020, the period whereby 
the rule in section 62(4) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 is 
suspended. That rule, which provides that Jobseeker’s Benefit is paid only from 
the fourth day of unemployment will be waived until 19 June 2020. 

These Regulations also reposition this provision within the Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 as article 52H. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [164] 5
